intro: Linkia angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered linkia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
